selected_quotes: 190 solar experts sign open letter asking politicians not to scrap $1.3 billion in renewable energy research
tfw heaps of scientists think your renewable energy budget cuts are stupid af #saveARENA
Dear politicians, please don't endanger world-leading solar research by cutting
#solar researchers have sent an open letter calling on all political parties to protect
#Scientists urge the government not to cut ARENA

citation.abstract: An open letter from 182 solar energy researchers in defence of the Australian Renewable Energy Agency, which has funded world-leading research.
citation.title: Dear politicians, please don't endanger world-leading solar research by cutting ARENA

news.title: Cutting ARENA would devastate clean energy research
news.summary: This week’s first sitting of the 45th Parliament of Australia is considering a A$6.5 billion “omnibus savings bill”, including a proposed cut of A$1.3 billion to the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA).

news.title: Uncertainty about Arena halts renewable energy projects
news.summary: Renewable energy projects in Australia are already being suspended as a result of the two major parties’ plans to effectively abolish the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (Arena).

news.title: Australian Renewable Energy Agency saved but with reduced funding – experts react
news.summary: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) has been granted a funding lifeline of A$800 million over the next five years, after the federal government and opposition came to an agreement that will save the agency.

news.title: Despite the funding cut, ARENA's glass is still half full – here's how to spend the money
news.summary: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) will suffer a A$500 million funding cut, after being saved from a far worse fate during negotiations over the government’s proposed budget savings package.

news.title: UNSW welcomes compromise to ARENA funding
news.summary: (via noodls) / UNSW has welcomed the decision to spare ARENA from dramatic funding cuts, which will allow it to continue to support critical Australian re into new renewable energy and storage technologies.

news.title: Despite the funding cut, ARENA’s glass is still half full – here’s how to spend the money
news.summary: (via noodls) / Despite a $500 million cut, the Australian Renewable Energy Agency has survived and can still help drive the renewable energy revolution, write Andrew Blakers and Richard Corkish.
